intro: Andryala integrifolia subsp. perennans, commonly known as the perennial sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically hairy. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
